The role includes international contacts both internally and externally, with customers, agents, audit and advisor/accounting firms.
 



 This is a full-time role based at LISA YANG’s HQ in Stockholm, and you will report to the Head of Finance.
 



  





**About the role** 




  






 ·       Responsibility for the day-to-day accounting i.e. general ledger entries
 





 ·       Preparation of monthly, quarterly, and year-end financial statements
 





 ·       VAT and other statutory reporting on a monthly and quarterly basis
 





 ·       Provide support and guidance to the Financial Assistant handling Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable, ensuring compliance with financial policies and internal procedures
 





 ·       Oversee and support the Accounts Receivable process, ensuring timely collections and accurate reporting to the Head of Finance
 





 ·       Make sure that the company complies with rules and regulations
 




 ·       
 
 Monitor and control operational costs to ensure efficiency, profitability and adherence to budget targets
 





 ·       Ensure data-driven analyses to support senior management’s decision making
 





 ·       Take part in budgets, forecast and setting KPI’s to support business objectives
 




  





**Your profile** 











 •        Minimum bachelor’s degree in business administration/finance, preferably majoring in accounting. MBA and/or CPA is a plus
 





 •        At least 3 years of working experience from accounting and/or financial control, preferably in an international context
 





 •        Outstanding numerical and analytical problem-solving skills
 





 •        Strong planning and organizational skills
 





 •        Ability to breakdown complex accounting and finance concepts to non-financial colleagues across the organization
 





 •        Fluency in English and Swedish
 





 •        Advance proficiency in Excel and MS Office applications
 





 •        Experience from the ERP system NetSuite is a merit as well as previous work within the fashion industry
 




  







**About you** 













 It is crucial that your personality matches LISA YANG values. We believe you have;
 











 •        A passion for the LISA YANG brand
 





 •        Driven, self-motivated and results oriented
 





 •        High level of personal drive and eagerness to work collaboratively in a team
 





 •        Able to multitask, solve issues smoothly and quickly switch focus when needed
 





 •        Competent in building and developing relationships, both internally and externally
 





 •        A growth mindset, willing to develop and open to change

title: Associate Product Specialist-R-241955
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Associate Product Specialist
   

  

 Specialist, Authentication Market Product Management, Northern Europe
   

  

 Mastercard Core Payments provides a set of innovative digital payment use cases (pay card on file, pay as a guest, pay with card in wallet) and the authentication solutions. Mastercard enables issuers, acceptance and digital partners to offer their customers a consistent and secure checkout experience across devices, browsers, and merchants starting from advanced authentication.
   

  

 The Authentication Product team manages authentication products and solutions including Mastercard Identity Check, Mastercard Passkeys and Mastercard Token Authentication Framework.
   

  

 We are seeking a specialist with a background in data analytics and/or consulting to drive data-driven research and strategy for our products as they are taken to market in the Northern Europe division. In this role, you will report to the Authentication Market Product lead for the Northern Europe division and bridge the gap between business strategy, data insights, and product development to deliver optimization and growth of our authentication solutions.
   

  

 You will engage with customers and internal stakeholders, gather requirements, and synthesize strategic recommendations, while your analytics proficiency will ensure sound data driven recommendations leveraging Mastercard’s extensive data assets. Your recommendations and data insights will be used at scale by the broader organization to enable, grow and optimize our authentication products.
   

  

 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

 Stakeholder & Customer Engagement
   

  

* Support customer engagements to drive product usage and optimization, and gather product feedback, whilst collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Regional Product, Customer Solutions Center, account management, and business development
* Conduct workshops, interviews, and stakeholder meetings to gather input and ensure alignment across teams.
* Act as a trusted advisor to division leadership, presenting strategic recommendations on authentication optimization opportunities, supported by data-driven analysis.


 Data Insights
   

  

* Leverage Mastercard’s data assets and data scientist workbench to deliver scalable data insights
* Drive market growth strategies and product performance optimization leveraging Mastercard data assets
* Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and ensure products are consistently delivering measurable value. Engage with customer facing teams to realize prioritized opportunities


 Market Insights & Competitive Analysis
   

  

* Conduct market research to identify customer pain points, opportunities, and competitive landscapes.
* Leverage insights to iterate and improve product positioning and differentiation.


 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Education & Experience
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in exact science or relevant field (e.g., Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, or related disciplines).
* 2+ years of experience in product management, consulting, or data-driven roles.
* Experience in (or willingness to learn) data science tools and frameworks (e.g., Python, R, SQL, Tableau, or similar)
* Proven ability to drive product strategy and execution in a fast-paced environment.


 Skills & Competencies
   

  

* Strong story-teller - adept at communicating insightful stories and producing impactful written materials and presentations
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data insights into actionable product decisions.
* Interest in payments industry and upcoming digital/authentication technologies
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Self-starter with a consulting mindset, able to adapt and thrive in ambiguity.
* Experience in working with data pipelines, and big data technologies is a plus.
* Languages: Entirely fluent in English plus second European language (Dutch, Swedish, other Scandinavian languages).


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.


 R-241955

title: Solution Architect - Integration & Cloud
description:
***Are you an experienced and passionate architect with a focus on Cloud and/or Integration - Find out how we can give you the future you want?***
**The Mission**
 As a Solution Architect @ Capgemini you will have a unique opportunity to help our customers design and implement the best technology solutions. Our assignments cover various sectors like telecom, retail, finance, utilities, industries, media, and public. The assignments will be on-site in the Stockholm region and you will cooperate closely with your expert colleagues in Stockholm as well as within some of the Capgemini companies globally, including State Of the Art solutions, education, and support from our partners
   

  

**The Role**
 You will be expected to shape and translate Business and IT strategy and needs into realizable, sustainable technology solutions. You will provide insight, thought leadership, and innovation to ensure that the solution meets the client’s business goals. You will ensure that the solution is designed for production and can be delivered efficiently while making sure that the solution has integrity (is safe, secure, and compliant). You will be responsible for creating technical solution descriptions (High-Level Design and Detailed Design documentation) through collaboration with the customer team and colleagues.
   

  

**Your profile**
 As a Solution Architect, we expect you to have a broad technical understanding, developer background, and strong communication skills with the ability to guide and advise our clients. You have an agile mindset; are quick to adapt to challenges and learn from new experiences.
   

  

***Skills required:***
* You have experience working as Architect, including being responsible for Solution Architecture Document (SAD) or similar
* Previous design development experience using technologies such as .Net, C#, Web API or Java, J2EE
* Experience in defining Integration Roadmaps & Architecture and/or working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP, etc.)
* Knowledge of different industry best practices in API, integration & Microservices
* Familiar with agile ways of working and DevOps
* You have a higher diploma (e.g. Bachelor or Masters degree) or equel
* You are fluent in both Swedish and English


***To stand out, you also have previous experience:***
* From the consulting industry
* Experience in Mulesoft, OpenShift, Kafka, DelBoomi, or similar solution platforms
* Certified in architecture; generic (such as TOGAF) and/or platforms (such as AWS, GCP, Azure, Mulesoft, OpenShift)
* Experience as an Architect in some of our customer's industries


***We Offer***
 A positive work environment with a strong focus on innovation and customer excellence. You will be working with many of the latest technology trends and be surrounded by skilled colleagues. At Capgemini, you will be part of a global organization with high client focus, collaborative culture, and an opportunity for continuous learning and development.
   

  

 Our Digital Architecture team in Stockholm consists of +30 colleagues who are delivering Enterprise, Business, and Solution Architecture projects to our clients, taking end-to-end responsibility to ensure that the right architecture is implemented. Capgemini has been a predominant actor in the architecture field since the ’90s, with our own Integrated Architecture Framework (IAF) and we are actively contributing to the development of TOGAF. We have a Global Architecture Community as well as local affiliates where you can leverage global and local expertise as well as contribute with your own.
   

  

**Some Other Benifits**
* Exciting career opportunities locally and internationally, and fantastic networks of expertise. With over 1500 colleagues in Sweden only, you are part of a sharp, technology and business focused community, where Coursera and more than 250 000 (!) courses and certifications are offered to all employees.
* A variety of innovative projects with well-known clients and world-leading partners – being part of a global, long-standing, successful and rapidly expanding organization.
* An inclusive corporate culture where Diversity is our most important guiding principle. We are continuously engaged in initiatives that promote diversity and women in tech; we run LGBTQ networks and aim for inclusion in all types of staff activities – from sports club to art association. Please find out more about Capgemini as an employer HERE.


 All employees are covered by a collective agreement and receive occupational pension, insurance, parental benefits and health care allowance – among other best-in-class benefits.
   

  

**In recent employee surveys, our employees particularly emphasized:**
* A friendly and flexible workplace culture
* Supportive managers and freedom of speech
* Strong values and diversity focus
* Good work-life balance


**Our Values**
* Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Functional D365 F&O Lead SCM
description:
**Who is the Company and Context?** 




 We are a global leader in our industry, committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology to enhance operational efficiency and deliver superior services. Our recent initiative involves the comprehensive implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365, integrating it with systems like PLM, web platforms, and Power BI. This extensive program encompasses multiple projects, from technology selection to global rollouts, all aimed at creating a cohesive and efficient operational framework.
 



  





**What Will I Be Doing?** 




 In the role of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Specialist (Business Services Group Lead), you will be at the forefront of our Dynamics 365 implementation. You will gather and analyze business requirements, lead solution design, oversee data management and migration, and configure the system to meet our organizational needs. Additionally, you will manage various testing phases, develop training materials, and support users during the go-live process. Your expertise will be crucial in ensuring the successful integration and ongoing support of the system.
 



  





**What Kind of Skills and Background Will I Need to Have?** 




 To excel in this position, you should have:
 


* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field.
* 5-8 years of hands-on experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365, particularly in sales, order management, and manufacturing.
* Proven success in managing large, complex Dynamics 365 ERP projects, including data migration and integrations.
* Familiarity with tools such as Jira, ServiceNow, and SharePoint, along with experience in international settings.
* Strong collaborative and communication skills, with the ability to multitask effectively.
* Fluency in English is essential; understanding Swedish will be an advantage.



  





**Why Should I Apply for This Role?** 




 This role offers an exciting opportunity to lead a significant technological transformation within a dynamic global organization. You will have the chance to work with a talented team, influence key business processes, and contribute to the success of a major initiative. If you are passionate about driving change through innovative technology and have the skills and experience we’re looking for, this is the perfect opportunity to advance your career while making a meaningful impact. Join us and be part of our journey towards operational excellence!
 



  





**How do I apply?** 




 Get in touch with David at david.tydesten@systemsaccountants.com
 








**Who we are?** 




 SystemsAccountants is a leading global Financial Systems, Analytics, and Transformation recruitment company. We provide permanent & contractor recruitment solutions to enable clients to implement, support, develop, run & optimise, ERP, ERP and Analytics systems. We source and screen finance systems professionals on a global basis. Unlike typical search & selection firms, our consultants have an international reach, which ensures that our clients and candidates receive market insight along with a tailored service.

title: Web3 - Product Owner
description:
Are you a Product Owner with a passion for i-Gaming, blockchain and pushing the boundaries of innovation? We're looking for a talented product owner to join our team and help us bring Betsson Group's vision “to provide the best customer experience in the industry” to life.
 


  

**The Wow** 
  




 We are looking for a talented Product Owner to join our dynamic Web3 team and help shape the future of our company.
 


  
 

 The selected candidate with
 

 lead
 

 the concept & delivery of our
 

 cutting-edge
 

 In-house
 

 Games, ensuring
 

 timely
 

 delivery and alignment with
 

 Betsson’s
 

 strategic goals.
 



  

**A taster of what you will be involved with** 
  

  
* Produce detailed product specifications in the form of user stories with detailed acceptance criteria, complemented by descriptive aids such as wireframes and flowcharts where necessary, to ensure the development teams have all required information to deliver the desired outcome.
  
* Lead the product discovery process for assigned initiatives (including hypothesis generation, requirements gathering, design, and scoping) in collaboration with the Head of Product, product designers, data analysts, and engineers.
  
* Assist the Head of Product in ensuring that the product development backlog is properly organised, prioritised, and kept up to date.
  
* Contribute to the product vision, and champion this vision with stakeholders and the engineering teams.
  
* Ensure that proper analytics, tracking and data collection mechanisms are in place to understand user behaviours and/or product performance.
  
* Provide the necessary product support to the development teams as may be required to aid their delivery.
  
* Work with other parts of the organisation as and when necessary to ensure the expected outcomes are achieved and are measured.
  
* Communicate product releases and the status of ongoing product development to the wider organisation.
  
* Hold effective demos and trainings with stakeholders for new product concepts and releases as and when required.
  
* Ensure that relevant product documentation and wikis are well maintained.
  
* Perform user acceptance  & A/B testing of new product releases (or ensure co-ordination of) alongside the Product Designer.
  
* Continuously reviewing the product to identify areas for improvement and any deviations from the expected experience.
  
* Assist and support the Head of Product in any matters as may be delegated from time to time.
  
* Learning the market & customer needs through data and customer feedback.
  
* Facilitating workshops and leading meetings.  Managing design sprints, user story mapping sessions, and lead discussions about customer feedback and product requirements.
  


  

 What we are looking for
   

  
* A relevant academic degree or qualifications; preferably technology and / or business related.
  
* At least 2 years of experience working in a similar role.
  
* Skilled at creating and maintaining a product delivery roadmap & prioritising features
  
* Understanding of all aspects of game production including maths, mechanics, art & sound.
  
* Strong understanding of the iGaming market
  
* Excellent communication skills in English, both verbally and in writing.
  
* Experience working with agile and remote development teams.
  
* Comfortable and confident working with both the technical and commercial sides of an organisation.
  
* A team player capable of building positive working relationships across the company.
  
* A keen eye for detail and a user centric mindset.
  
* Working with Jira, Confluence, Figma, Google Analytics, Github or equivalent.
  
* An understanding of Blockchain/Web3 Technologies will be considered a plus.
  


  

 What we offer
   


 Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 2500 strong, spread across 7 offices with 1700 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 


  


 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
 


  

 Challenge Accepted?
   


***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy***

title: Modern Workplace Engineering Architect | M365
description:
Unlock the potential of Modern Workplace Engineering Architecture as a visionary architect, transforming challenges into cutting-edge solutions and leading the transformation and the empowerment of business to thrive in the digital era with Microsoft technologies.
   

  

**Come join us**
 Are you a visionary Microsoft 365 Architect? Join our Modern Workplace Practice and unleash your expertise in crafting innovative solutions that harness the full potential of Microsoft 365 suite. You will have a pivotal role in our team as Solution Architect where you will need to understand the business needs and requirements and turn it into innovative solutions based on Microsoft technologies. You will become the front figure in projects and mentor to your peers to drive transformative success with your unparalleled skillset.
 **Together we do what matters.**
**Skills And Experiences**
 You have previous and solid experience with:
   

  

* Demonstrating confidence in designing end-to-end solutions across Microsoft 365 suite.
* Showing good control and eager leadership in managing clients' conversations.
* Understanding business advantages in Microsoft security tools (i.e. Defender and Purview).
* Implementing Microsoft Identity and Endpoint Management techniques and best practices.
* Using with natural proficiency PowerShell.
* Applying strong business acumen in migrations tools (i.e. Quest), Code controls (i.e. Git repositories), ITSM tools, Azure and automation.
* Showing a critical thinking, problem-solving and troubleshooting approach.


**About You**
 You’re a natural leader who fosters collaboration and manages dynamic teams to drive project success. You will proactively identify business opportunities to enhance and expand the range of Microsoft 365 suite business solutions provided to clients. Your interpersonal and communication skills help technical and non-technical clients engage with often complex information.
   

  

**Characteristics That Can Spell Success For This Role Are**
* Stay ahead of the curve and explore groundbreaking solutions with a genuine thirst for success.
* Be an adviser to emerging technologists on career growth opportunities.
* Act as a trusted mentor, providing performance reviews and feedback when necessary.
* Be a relationship builder, engaging with clients to ensure their satisfaction.


**What You'll Do**
 As a Modern Workplace Engineering Architect, your focus is on Microsoft 365 suite solutions within the Workplace services field. You will apply your expertise in M365 solutioning by translating business requirements into innovative technical solutions. Acting as a front figure in projects, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams under challenging circumstances to deliver high-quality solutions, ensuring customer satisfaction and fostering client relationships. You will stay updated with the latest technological trends in the Modern Workplace domain and attend partner events, sharing best practices and mentoring professional coworkers in the Modern Workplace domain to deliver cutting-edge solutions.
   

  

**Learn more**
 To learn more about the types of projects our Modern Workplace team works on check out these case studies:
   

  

* Why now is the time to modernize your communications capabilities
* Workplace experience: Why evergreen is everything


 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

* Avanade Insights – exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation
* Inside Avanade – explore what life is like working at Avanade


**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year, with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


  

  

 Find out more about some of our benefits Employee Benefits at Avanade | Avanade
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

  

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


  

  

 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


  

  

 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one

title: Systemförvaltare till Skandia Investment Management
description:
Skandia Investment Management (SIM) är Skandias kapitalförvaltningsbolag och ingår i affärsområdet Skandia Kapitalförvaltning med ca 100 medarbetare. SIM förvaltar och administrerar betydande delar av Skandia Livs och Skandia Fonders placeringstillgångar och har idag 46 anställda och cirka 490 miljarder kronor under förvaltning.
   

  

 Gruppen System Administration & IT består av 6 personer inklusive chef. Vårt ansvar inkluderar områden som verksamhetsutveckling, användarsupport, projektledning och effektivisering av våra processer.
   

  

 Nu söker vi efter en kvalificerad affärsinriktad systemförvaltare av SimCorp Dimension till gruppen, där tjänsten är placerad på huvudkontoret på Kungsholmen, Lindhagensgatan 86.
   

  

**Om rollen som systemförvaltare**
 I rollen som systemförvaltare kommer du att vara länken som förstår verksamhetens behov och kan översätta beställningar till färdiga systemlösningar.
   

  

 Utöver att fungera som användarstöd till verksamheten samt löpande arbeta med konfigurering och parametersättning i våra system kommer du också att delta i och leda olika typer av system-och effektiviseringsprojekt för att vidareutveckla kapitalförvaltningens processer. Det är därför av stor vikt att du har förståelse för verksamheten och dess behov.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Vi söker dig som antingen har tidigare erfarenhet av en liknande roll inom systemförvaltning och/eller erfarenhet från arbete inom front-, middle- eller back-office inom en kapitalförvaltning där du kanske har ansvarat för viss konfigurering av systemet SimCorp Dimension.
   

  

 Genom arbetet har du fått goda kunskaper om systemet och en förståelse för de finansiella instrument som finns på marknaden. Du är systemintresserad med en vilja att effektivisera processer och det är ett krav att du har goda kunskaper i SimCorp Dimension.
   

  

 Du har sannolikt en akademisk utbildning och behärskar svenska och engelska flytande, i såväl tal som skrift.
   

  

 För att trivas och passa in i gruppen är det viktigt att du är analytisk, noggrann, har god samarbetsförmåga samt att du har ett prestigelöst förhållningssätt. Det är även viktigt att du är ansvarstagande och drivande, har förmågan att ta egna initiativ och ett fokus på att slutföra saker med kvalitet.
   

  

**Vad händer nu**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Skandia med rekryteringsföretaget Uniqruit och alla ansökningar och CV skickas till ansvarig rekryterare Tobias Danielsson på Uniqruit.
   

  

 För att söka tjänsten klicka på ansök, då kommer du vidare till Uniqruits annons där du kan skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta Tobias Danielsson på 0721–864773 www.uniqruit.com.

title: Aktuarie till Skandikon
description:
*Vill du arbeta kundnära och i en verksamhet med ett ständigt utvecklingsfokus? Drivs du av att arbeta med beräkningar, bokslut och kravställning? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig! På Skandikon garanterar vi en variationsrik vardag i en familjär miljö, där processförbättringar och effektivisering är våra största fokusområden.*
**Att jobba som Aktuarie på Skandikon**
 Aktuarie, Skuld och Kostnad består idag av fyra anställda aktuarier och en controller, samt ett antal konsulter. Som aktuarie på Skandikon utför du tjänster som bokslutsberäkningar och andra beräkningar för försäkringsbolag och för kommuner och regioner. Du kommer att ingå i teamet som ansvarar för beräkningar till flera av Sveriges försäkringsbolag.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna handlar om att göra beräkningar, övriga analyser på beställning samt kontrollera beräkningar i våra system och filer vi levererar till kund för att de ska kunna göra bokslut. Vidare kommer du att arbeta nära vår IT-avdelning med kravställning och utveckling av våra system då Skandikon arbetar med flera större projekt där vi migrerar in nya bestånd i vårt egenutvecklade system Vera. Det kommer också att finnas möjlighet att utveckla våra modeller, processer och arbetssätt.
   

  

**Vad kan Skandikon och rollen erbjuda dig?**
 Våra medarbetare är vår största konkurrensfördel. Vi gör komplexa processer enkla och för det krävs djup kompetens och en förmåga att förbli innovativ.
   

  

 Skandikons medarbetaridé är att vi vill kombinera affärsmässighet och dokumenterad spetskompetens med lyhördhet, initiativförmåga och ett starkt personligt engagemang till våra kunder. Då vi växer och utvecklar vår verksamhet är det därför även viktigt att du drivs av att jobba i projekt och en omväxlande miljö med högt tempo. Vi kan i vår tur erbjuda dig en öppen och lärorik arbetsplats i och med det utpräglade samarbetet mellan avdelningarna. Vi premierar nytänkande, egna initiativ och låter våra medarbetare påverka sitt arbete. Ta chansen och sök idag och bli del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsplats!
   

  

 ,
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen** 
 har du minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom relevant område samt en akademisk utbildning med matematisk/statistisk inriktning eller civilingenjörsutbildning med fördjupning inom matematik. Obehindrad svenska i tal och skrift är ett krav.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av att arbeta som aktuarie med livförsäkring är meriterande liksom kunskap om och erfarenhet av förmånsbestämd pension, försäkringsteknik och försäkringstekniska avsättningar, kunskaper i SQL samt Excel.
   

  

 I den här rekryteringen kommer vi även att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vi söker dig som drivs av att arbeta med ständiga förbättringar och har förmågan att självständigt driva initiativ framåt. Du är analytisk, arbetar metodiskt och strukturerat samt är noggrann i ditt arbete. Du har ett stort kundfokus samt fokus på att alltid leverera hög kvalité, är en prestigelös lagspelare med energi och har en positiv inställning till förändringar.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 I denna rekrytering arbetar vi med löpande urval. Har du frågor kring rollen vänligen ta kontakt med rekryterande chef camilla.hiertner@skandikon.se. För övriga frågor är du hjärtligt välkommen att kontakta susanne.hedberg@skandia.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 I den här processen har vi följande steg;
   

  

* Verksamhets intervju
* Team intervju
* Personlighets- och logisk test med efterföljande djupintervju
* Slutdiskussion
* Referenser
* Bakgrundskontroll

title: Enhetschef – led arbetet på skatteekonomiska enheten
description:
**Skatteekonomiska enheten** 
**, Finansdepartementet** 
 Är du en kvalificerad nationalekonom med mycket goda vitsord? Är du en engagerad ledare och verksamhetsföreträdare? Vill du medverka i uppdraget att hjälpa regeringen att förverkliga sin politik? Som chef på Finansdepartementet får du en variationsrik roll i händelsernas centrum.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Som chef för skatteekonomiska enheten vid skatte- och tullavdelningen axlar du de tre roller som chefskapet i Regeringskansliet bjuder. Du får möjlighet att leda medarbetare, agera verksamhetsföreträdare och verka som arbetsgivarföreträdare med målet att fortsätta utveckla myndighetens förmåga att vara ett effektivt och kompetent instrument till regeringen i dess uppdrag att styra riket och förverkliga sin politik.
   

  

 Ditt uppdrag som enhetschef innebär att leda, utveckla och organisera arbetet samt ansvara för enhetens verksamhet som i huvudsak rör analyser av hur förändrade skatteregler påverkar samhällsekonomisk effektivitet och offentliga finanser. På enheten arbetar man även med internationella uppdrag, främst inom EU och OECD, samt deltar i utredningsarbete. På enheten arbetar cirka 20 kvalificerade medarbetare.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara personalansvarig för enhetens medarbetare som du leder, motiverar, inspirerar och utvecklar i det dagliga arbetet, du utvecklar verksamheten mot uppställda mål och ansvarar för att organisera och planera arbetet på enheten. Som enhetschef företräder du också verksamheten i många olika sammanhang, såväl internt som externt och det är viktigt att du vid alla tillfällen agerar som god företrädare för myndigheten.
   

  

 Skatte- och tullavdelningen består av sex enheter och som enhetschef ingår du i avdelningens ledningsgrupp.
   

  

**Din bakgrund och kompetens**
 Vi söker dig som har akademisk examen med inriktning mot nationalekonomi och ingående kunskaper om och erfarenhet av enhetens ansvarsområden. Du har erfarenhet av att leda andra, goda kunskaper och erfarenhet av offentlig ekonomi samt erfarenhet av att förmedla analysresultat från t.ex. forsknings- och myndighetsvärlden. Dessutom har du goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från arbete på Regeringskansliet, erfarenhet av mikrodata och kvantitativa metoder samt arbete med stora datamaterial.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 I rollen som chef förväntar vi oss att du har god kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga samt förmåga att se helheten och att du kan leda och styra verksamheten strategiskt och utvecklingsinriktat. Du ska ha en naturlig läggning för att skapa effektiva arbetsmetoder, är självständig, tar egna initiativ och skapar kreativa lösningar för en effektiv struktur i verksamheten. Ett gott samarbete mellan enheten och övriga enheter på avdelningen är avgörande för uppdraget. Vidare är du samhällsintresserad och har förståelse för de krav som ställs på att arbeta i en politiskt styrd organisation. Sammantaget skapar detta goda förutsättningar att lyckas med enhetens uppdrag.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning med ett tidsbegränsat förordnande som enhetschef.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?**
 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta finansrådet Niklas Ekstrand via Regeringskansliets växel 08-405 10 00. Du är också välkommen att kontakta HR-handläggare Catrine Thudén på telefon 08-405 38 67. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Simon Monti Danielsson och Ben Hadj Ali för SACO och Lotta Nordqvist för ST. Du når dem via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast den 20 mars 2025.
   

  

 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Finansdepartementet ansvarar för frågor som rör statens ekonomi. Det handlar om samordning av statens budget, prognoser och analyser, skattefrågor samt styrning och förvaltning av statens verksamhet. Dessutom ansvarar departementet för frågor som rör finansmarknad, kommuner och regioner, upphandling, bolag med statligt ägande, digitalisering och it samt konsumentlagstiftning.

title: DATA & MARKET INTELLIGENCE MANAGER
description:
We are searching for analytical, business-minded, data loving
 



  





**DATA & MARKET INTELLIGENCE MANAGER** 




  





 to join our Nordic Miele Marketing team. As the Data & Business Intelligence Manager, you will be the Go-To-Person for product and master data, as well as for business analyses and insights. Your aim is to improve the efficiency, effectiveness, create value and improve performance of the Nordic marketing functions. You are passionate about developing the Nordic business with analyses and insights and have a precision to guarantee compliance with local laws in all marketing activities.
 



  





 You can work in any of our Nordic countries: Denmark/Copenhagen, Finland/Vantaa, Norway/Oslo, or Sweden/Stockholm. We offer the flexibility of hybrid work, enabling you to work partially remotely. Additionally, we highly value community and team spirit, and we encourage everyone to contribute to this.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 



* Analyse and develop Miele’s category and brand performance, support the organisation to drive improvements, value and growth in the Nordics based on market intelligence
* Develop, implement and optimise standardized processes to enhance efficiency and collaboration within the marketing team / Business Units / Global
* Optimize the product data quality and processes
* Provide a foundation to data and insight-based marketing strategy and promotional planning in the Nordics
* Be responsible for product price management and product master data for all products in all categories in the Nordics
* Work across sales and marketing in all channels, and to collaborate with Business Units on a category marketing level, as well as with relevant stakeholders in internationally at Miele Headquarters.
* Optimize Nordic and local product category activities based on market intelligence and analyses to deliver upon agreed KPIs, and constantly maintain and optimize product data quality and processes.
* Ensure that all marketing activities comply with applicable data protection laws and regulations
* Research constantly marketing automation tools to streamline repetitive tasks and optimize the overall marketing processes



  





**Your experience and competencies** 



* A drive for data, analyses, business-intelligence and process optimization. You are a strategic thinker with pronounced analytical skills.
* Super-user and advanced skills in SAP and Excel.
* A passion to drive change. You are constantly looking for improvements and business opportunities through analyses and data
* A strong business understanding and acumen, and a distinct commercial mindset.
* You bring a bachelor’s degree in Process Management, Business & Data Administration, Marketing or similar, as well as prior experience in similar positions.
* Strong relationship, networking and negotiation skills. You smoothly and fluently collaborate in English, both in writing and orally.
* Preferably knowledge of local Nordic compliance requirements (ie. Data laws, regulatory affairs)



  





**We offer** 




 An independent, exciting and versatile job, with the global and local support of a well-established international company as well as the opportunity for continuous development. We have good employment conditions, competitive salary and supportive working environment. We value our open and warm company culture with diversity and inclusion. Read more about our culture:
 **Welcome to Miele Nordics - Miele Nordics** 




  





**Interested?** 




 We are excited to welcome our new colleague to our team, so we are looking to fill this position soonest.
 



  





 Send your application with CV and any other relevant documents via the link below in English as soon as possible and no later than March 16th, 2025. We review applications on an ongoing basis.
 



  





 If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Anu Heino, Nordic Marketing Director by e-mail anu.heino[at]miele.com
 



  





*MAKE IT BETTER. BE BETTER.* 




  





*What does it take for a family-run company to become world market leader in the premium domestic appliance segment? It takes more than offering average products, run-of-the-mill service or short-sighted actions. It also requires the aspiration to do it forever better and to be forever better – “Immer Besser”. This stance accounts for a good working environment at Miele and the success of our products. Our colleagues can rest assured that those who live up to our standards of quality and professionalism grow personally and professionally.* 




  





*Make our claim your challenge! Become one of more than 20,100 Miele employees in 50 countries around the world who are committed to making our products even better every day - and help us to expand our innovation leadership!*

title: Creative Production Lead
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
We're looking for a creative genius that can ideate and ship content so inspirational and educational that it creates a new generation of builders. We want you to build Lovable's video empire from scratch via viral-worthy technical content across Youtube, Tiktok, Instagram, and podcasts that makes AI engineering accessible and exciting. Must have serious production chops and understand our technology with ease.
   

  

 Why Lovable?
   

  

* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
* Work, learn, have fun: We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


 What we're looking for
   

  

* You run a Youtube channel / podcast, or held this role at another growth (tech) company
* You understand tech & get what content builders (developers & non-developers) love
* Serious skills in video production, editing, and motion graphics
* High comfort being behind & in front of the camera / mic and interacting with technical and non-technical counterparts
* Hungry for a lot of ownership and the expectation to create great things quickly


 Your responsibilities
   

  

* Own and execute our video content strategy & production pipeline from start to finish, directing, shooting, and editing yourself & with external partners
* Build an exceptional web content presence that attracts traffic & engagement
+ Our youtube channel with long-form educational content (and potentially expanding this to a learning platform like Coursera / Udemy)
+ Short-form content for Youtube, Instagram, and Tiktok
+ Technical podcast featuring top AI builders and engineers

* Direct and produce product launches, customer stories, and live demo content
* Design our motion and visual language system across all platforms
* Build a team of creative superstars as we grow our video production capabilities
* This is an in-office role (5 days a week)


 How applying works
   

  

* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* We'll send you a quick take-home for (1) a written case study and (2) a loom video presentation
* If possible, join us for a week of (paid) trial work. We'll see you working in-person and you get to meet the team & explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you Apply by clicking the link below.

title: Global Clinical Applications Manager, Solna Sweden
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 Getinge Critical care in Solna is an inspiring workplace where we develop and produce advanced medical devices such as ventilators, anesthesia machines, intracortical balloon pumps and advanced hemodynamic monitors. We are proud of our products and our skilled colleagues that contributes to bring lifesaving solutions to the market every day.
   

  

**About The Position**
 To our product management team, we are now looking for a clinical application specialist to help us build the future of our ventilation platform. You will make a difference by, together with our highly motivated and skilled team, develop the new standard of life supporting and lifesaving ventilators. In this role you will report to the Director of Global Product Management for Ventilation. The position is located in Solna.
   

  

**Day To Day Responsibilities Will Include**
* Participate in the development of new products and services
* Plan and conduct validation based on intended use and clinical user needs
* Support and implement product and application training with both Getinge's international sales organization, distributors, and end-customers
* Support the development of marketing and educational materials
* Coordinate collaborations with Key Opinion Leaders
* Provide clinical support to our international sales companies and distributors
* Participate in risk analysis and assessment in connection with incident reporting
* Participate in setting requirements and risk analysis of clinically related product properties
* Participate as a clinical specialist at international congresses and tradeshows


 In this role, you are required to travel both internationally and domestically. However, to help meet our goals of becoming CO2 neutral by 2025, we travel only if we must.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 At Getinge, we are looking for passionate individuals, who are agile, resilient, take responsibility for their development and focus on achieving excellence. As a person you are a collaborative team player, who likes having lots of contacts with different stakeholders. You drive results, take action and find prioritizations. You take pride in understanding customer’s needs and have good planning and documentation skills. You like to read and keep up with the latest clinical research. You are curious, good at building relationships with both internal and external partners and have a proven ability to lead and drive your own work.
   

  

**What you bring**
* Nursing degree with or equivalent and have at least 5 years of clinical experience
* Specialist nurse in neonatal intensive care
* High customer orientation
* Excellent communication skills
* Excellent English skills, both written and spoken. Swedish is beneficial, but not a must.


 In addition to your technical skills, we highly value your personality. At Getinge we see ourselves as proactive and self-driven in learning and contributing to the continued development of our products and our organization's capabilities.  We are Team Players, Forward Thinkers and Game Changers.
   

  

 We think you will thrive in a high-expectation environment and have an interest in our products.
   

  

**Our Benefits**
 We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, including wellness and training programs, to ensure we support your well-being and goals. We strive for all our employees to be able to achieve a good work-life harmony. We have introduced a flexible approach to our workplaces, and therefore you will have the opportunity to work remotely part time. Having said that, this position is located in Solna, Sweden, to be close to R&D and other stakeholders.
   

  

 Please send your application no later than March 15th, 2025. If you have any questions regarding this position, please contact Jennie Haag at email: jennie.haag@getinge.com or Talent Acquisition Manager Emma Paulsson at emma.paulsson@getinge.com.
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.
   

  

 Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Bosch & Siemens Home Appliances - Nordic Campaign Manager
description:
Are you naturally curious, do you enjoy taking initiative, and have an inner entrepreneur ready to shine? Then this is the opportunity for you! At B/S/H Home Appliances we lead the market in the home appliances industry with the most powerful brands in the Nordics.
   

  

 We are seeking a new Nordic Campaign Manager to work within the small but growing Consumer Products Marketing Team for Region Northern Europe. Our mission is to guide consumers through their purchase journey, effectively and efficiently along all touchpoints of the CEJ. We aim to strengthen brand building and engage consumers even before they make a purchase. As the majority of our brand investments are made along digital channels, ensuring our website pages offer an optimised landing experience is also a high priority. Initially, the main focus will be on driving the campaigns for our largest & most important category, under the Bosch brand, where we have several strategic launches and a full product road map to deliver in the next 12 months. It is important to note that we are a small dynamic team, and tasks, responsibilities & projects are likely to adapt and expand with time.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities And Tasks**
* Skillfully adapt, optimize, coordinate, and implement communication materials from our Global headquarters, seamlessly integrating them with locally crafted communication materials, whether in-house or from creative agencies.
* Collaborate closely with Head of Marketing to set objectives and manage budgets across various activities.
* Continuously monitor and evaluate campaigns, working closely with external agencies and internal experts to enhance efficiency in spreading our brand and messages.
* Coordinate with other stakeholders within BSH, presenting campaign plans, reports and materials to larger audiences.
* Act as Consumer Products touchpoint owner for Nordic brand websites – enabling content releases, briefing digital hub for local implementations & overseeing execution.


**Your Profile And Qualifications**
 This role demands a blend of creativity, strong communication skills, and organizational prowess. You should be driven, open to learning, and unafraid to initiate and lead new projects. Excellent communication skills and the ability to juggle multiple projects simultaneously is essential.
   

  

**Profile**
* University degree, preferably in marketing, business administration, communication, or design.
* Proficiency in project management.
* Knowledge of digital media advertising, along with an understanding of digital campaign tracking and optimization.
* Language skills: Fluent in English and at least one Nordic language, both spoken and written, with a keen sensitivity to tone. Fluency in Finnish would also be considered an advantage
* Familiarity with Microsoft Office programs like Excel and PowerPoint, and ideally some knowledge of Adobe Analytics, Facebook Business Manager, or Google Campaign Manager.


 In your role as the Nordic Campaign Manager for Consumer Products, you'll report to the Head of Marketing, Consumer Products Northern Europe and become an integral part of our Nordic team.
   

  

 This position is based in our Regional Head Office in Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

 If you are up for the adventure, let’s connect and chat about your future with us!
   

  

**Application**
*Please apply as soon as possible. Candidate evaluations and interviews are ongoing.*
*Questions? Please contact Sophie Gustafsson (sophie.gustafsson@bshg.com).*
*Want to learn more about BSH? Please visit:* 
*Welcome | BSH Home Appliances AB* 
*and to find out more about our products, please visit our Instagram.*
**If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact**

title: Purchasing Manager Pack & Energy Central & Northern Europe
description:
Feb 27, 2025
   

  

 Purchasing Manager Pack & Energy Central & Northern Europe
   

  

**About Barilla**
 At Barilla, we believe that every great journey begins with passion and a bold vision. From our humble beginnings in 1877 in a small shop in Parma, Italy, we’ve blossomed into a global leader in the food industry, guided by our commitment to progress and excellence.
   

  

 Today, Barilla is an international group present in more than 100 countries and we are proud to be recognized as the world’s top food company by reputation. With 20 beloved brands in our portfolio, we are world leader for pasta, the number one choice for ready-made sauces in Europe, leader for bakery products in Italy, and for crispbread across Scandinavia with Wasa.
   

  

 Our success story is written by a passionate team of 9,000 dedicated employees across 30 plants and offices worldwide, all united by a shared mission to nourish the future with purpose and passion.
   

  

**Are you ready to add your unique flavor to our journey?**
 Are you a strategic Purchasing Manager with high ambitions and the ability to build strong relations while managing several stakeholders and interesting projects? Do you want to work in a family own company yet with international width? Now you have the chance!
   

  

 Barilla is now looking for a full time Purchasing Manager Packaging & Energy - Central & Northern Europe, based in one of our locations in Sweden Stockholm or Germany Colone. The individual will report to the Purchasing Director Packaging & Promotional Materials.
   

  

 As our Purchasing Manager, you will contribute to the development and lead the implementation of purchasing strategies for Packaging Materials & Energy in Germany and Sweden and build a strong business-to-business relationship with suppliers within the Region and assure that the category is purchased in the most value-added manner.
   

  

 Key Accountabilities
   

  

* Conduct and update Market Analysis and local spend analysis by category/country/plant /supplier
* Implement the Category Sourcing Strategy locally in line with the guidelines shared with the Lead Buyer
* Apply and update of a local Risk Assessment and define Mitigation plans by category
* Execute local suppliers scouting activities and apply the correct process of supplier selection, request for quotations, evaluate the offers collected after RFQ
* Update main local category market drivers price trends by market intelligence providers (i.e.: PPI, ICIS) and evaluate eventual price variations
* Define, share, negotiate, evaluate and renew contracts
* Perform supplier evaluation (quality, service level, financial soundness, CSR, etc.) with the support of Supplier Quality Assurance and the Plants
* Manage the local category Suppliers Portfolio consistently between Supplier Segmentation, Sourcing Strategy and Risk Analysis
* Execute, track and monitor Cost Saving Projects (DTV, PCM, WC) and Sustainability and D&I projects
* Build the budget in line with the budget assumption, guarantee the correct execution of budget process, execute the rolling forecasts process (in terms of variance vs bdg)
* Establish and develop relationships with local Associations, Institutions and local players (i.e.: recovered paper buyers, traders, consultants, paper mills, converters, etc.)
* Support local projects (i.e.: P&G, FCR meetings)


**Qualifications**
* Degree in Engineering, Economics and other similar studies
* Fluent in English (Swedish / German knowledge will be considered as a plus)
* At least 2 years of work experience, preferably in Packaging (Technical areas or Purchasing)
* Project Management skills and the ability to work in parallel on different projects
* Strong people management skills, by driving shared goals, building trust and using an open communication
* Demonstration of leadership and ownership, showing curiosity and creativity, while building strong and trustful relationships
* Analytical and result driven with a strong “can do” attitude that allows sound decisions making within established guidelines
* International growth mindset, ideally proven with international experiences
* Willing to travel (up to 25%)


**Our Offer**
* High Responsibility: From day one, we entrust you with significant responsibilities. Your impact matters, and we recognize it.
* Personal Development: Join us for professional growth and gain global experience in a dynamic international setting, offering extensive exposure and opportunities to excel.
* Continuous Learning: We believe in growth. Expect regular feedback and training opportunities to maximize your potential.
* Flexible Work Arrangements: Embrace our hybrid approach, and flexible working hours.
* Diversity & Inclusion: Engage in national and international projects that champion diversity and inclusion. Your unique perspective matters here.
* Excellent Public Transportation Access: Whether you prefer biking or public transport, we have got you covered. Enjoy working in a stylish, modern office which ensures easy access to various transportation options.
* Motivated Team: Be part of a dynamic and international Purchasing Team. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and mutual support.
* Positive and Inclusive Culture: Experience a workplace where positivity and inclusivity are at the core. Our flat hierarchies encourage open communication and mutual respect.


 Application
   

  

 Candidates will be contacted by our international Recruiter at Talent Solutions, part of ManpowerGroup. Our Recruiter is based in Poland, for this reason, a number with the country code +48 will be used
   

  

 Applications and CVs are sent via our job portal www.barillacareers.com Join us / Current Job Opportunities. If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please get in touch with Talent Acquisition, Kamil Tokarski; kamil.tokarski@external.barilla.com.
   

  

 We are reviewing candidates regularly so do not wait with your application!
   

  

 At Barilla, we are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable workplace where diversity in all its forms is valued and embraced. Our employment policies and practices are designed to ensure equal employment opportunities for all, regardless of age, race, color, citizenship, faith, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, gender identity or characteristics of expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, medical condition, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Our commitment to equal employment stems from our unwavering belief that it is not only the right thing to do, but it is also a fundamental driver of innovation and business success.
   

  

 Purchasing
   

  

 Stockholm
   

  

 Permanent

title: Business Controller – Global Sales and Marketing, Operations and Business Process Technology (Location Flexible)
description:
**Business Controller – Global Sales and Marketing, Operations and Business Process Technology ( Flexible locat** 
**ion)**
 At Sandvik Coromant we are committed to teamwork and believe in the power of developing ideas and solutions together. We leverage our shared passion, diversity, open-mindedness and cooperative spirit to shape the future of our industry and, with it, the path of your career. We are seeking for people who are passionate in their work and possess the drive to excel to join us!
   

  

 Right now, we are looking for an experienced Business Controller with financial business understanding and ability to drive strategy execution of Sales Operations and Business Process Technology functions – a team thoroughly monitoring and caring for our customer support operations. We offer you the opportunity to be part of this global team in a multi-cultural environment combined with great chances to develop, both personally and professionally!
   

  

  

  

**About The Job**
  

  

 Your main purpose is to contribute to our efforts to reach the overall operational and financial goals within our Global Sales and Marketing team, focusing on Business Process and Technology and Sales Operations functions. You provide the extended management team with financial and operational information, insight, and advise enabling them to make the right business-critical decisions.
   

  

 Participating in the development of business strategies and plans, including business performance management, KPI development and implementation, modeling, analysis, sensitivity checks, return on investment analysis, comments and advise on financial implications is an important part of your assignment. You play an instrumental role in the execution of key activities to ensure the performance of the key financial and operational KPIs.
   

  

 Your responsibility include:
   

  

* Defining right KPIs to measure operational performance management of each sub department, ensuring data points, availability of reports and analysis, including advise on improvement actions
* Driving capacity efficiency and cost management analysis, advice and execution with the departments
* Driving monthly performance business reviews within the Global Sales Operations, Business Process Technology teams
* Preparation and distribution of all required financial and management reports, including analysis and follow-up on actual results versus targets and prior periods
* Preparing the annual and rolling forecasts, targets, ad hoc business plans where you lead the instructions and guidance for local entities ensuring the right process and that the process follows compliantly
* Follow up and define business plans, processes and actions in partnership with the various Sales Operations defined regions and monitor the financial results versus plans
* Ensuring the efficient functioning, identifies the needs and develops financial and controlling process and systems that supports day to day execution
* Interpreting, implementing and developing financial operating policies, provide/support/guide audits of commercial processes to ensure compliance with policies and procedures
* Participate/lead global projects/change initiatives within Global Sales & Marketing Controlling


 In this role you will be a key member of the Global Sales Operations and Business Process Technology department’s Senior Leadership Management team and Global Sales & Marketing Controller network. The location for this position is flexible, with a preference for Sweden. Global travel is included in your job.
   

  

  

  

**About You**
 We are looking for someone with a university degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Mathematics/Statistics or equivalent knowledge gained from work. You have proven experience in building, developing, mentoring, and inspiring a high-performing professional controlling and/or operational teams. Knowledge in SAP and its process and understanding data management is required in this position. You are highly proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel. Experience working in a matrix environment is a must and we expect an interest in new digital solutions while knowledge in Power BI and Microsoft CRM is a plus. A service sector-related background and experience in operations and/or IT is a plus. Acting in a global setting calls for fluency in English, verbally and in writing. An analytical mindset, problem-solving skills, and the ability to deep dive and investigate the relation of data points are a must. Curiosity for learning, understanding what drives results, linking actions to results, and connecting details to the bigger picture are essential. You should be able to link each department's drive/purpose to the bigger picture and have a strong understanding of strategy. Comfort and effectiveness in a matrix organization with influential management skills are also required.
   

  

 Your personality truly makes the difference and your ability to deal effectively with internal stakeholders on local, regional, and global levels is a valuable asset. By understanding our global strategy, you are able to translate them into day-to-day activities and easily balance quick business decisions with proper risk management; clearly communicating the impact on our business, our customers, and our employees. With a confidence in both yourself and your knowledge, you challenge us when necessary and happily promote new initiatives. Creating a safety-first culture is important to you and you aim to create a climate in which people want to take initiative, contribute, and feel comfortable in taking risks. We recognize and value your drive to succeed!
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we are proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career options. Are you intrigued? Visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than March,18 2025 . Read more about Sandvik and apply at https://www.home.sandvik/en/careers/job-search/, Job ID: R0076840
   

  

  

  

**Contact information** 
  

  

 For further information about this position please contact:
   

  

 Praskovia Sheremeteva, T&A Expert, praskovia.sheremeteva@sandvik.com
   

  

  

  

*Sandvik Coromant is part of the global industrial engineering group Sandvik and is at the forefront of developing manufacturing tools and machining solutions, with knowledge that drives the industry standards and innovations demanded by the metalworking industry now and in the next industrial era. Collaborations with educational institutions, extensive investment in research and development and strong customer partnership ensure the development of machining technologies that change, lead and drive the future of manufacturing. Sandvik Coromant owns over 1700 patents worldwide, employs around 8 000 staff, and is represented in more than 150 countries.*

title: Handläggare/Jurist till Rättssekretariatet, Förvaltningsavdelningen
description:
**Rättssekretariatet, Förvaltningsavdelningen**
 Vill du använda din kompetens till att ge kvalificerat stöd i frågor om bland annat utlämnande av allmänna handlingar och offentlighet och sekretess? Har du utpräglad servicekänsla, god kommunikationsförmåga och gillar att samarbeta med andra? Vi erbjuder dig omväxlande arbetsuppgifter i en händelserik miljö.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 I din roll som handläggare kommer du använda din kompetens genom handläggning av ärenden om utlämnande av allmänna handlingar och offentlighet och sekretess. Även andra arbetsuppgifter inom Rättssekretariatets ansvarsområden kan bli aktuellt. I ditt arbete kommer du ha kontakt med alla enheter i Förvaltningsavdelningen och övriga departement. I din roll ingår även att delta i projekt och i utbildningsinsatser.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se .
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Du har juristexamen eller annan relevant utbildning. Du har minst tre års arbetslivserfarenhet som av arbetsgivaren bedöms som relevant för befattningen. Du har goda kunskaper om allmänna handlingar och offentlighet och sekretess. Har du erfarenhet av arbete i Regeringskansliet är det meriterande, liksom annat arbete i offentlig förvaltning. Eftersom vi strävar efter att bli mer digitaliserade i vårt arbete ser vi även att du gärna har relevant erfarenhet av arbete med digitalisering.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 För rollen krävs att du har en mycket väl utvecklad samarbetsförmåga men också är självgående och kan arbeta självständigt. Eftersom det är ett högt tempo krävs att du kan agera snabbt och är noggrann och kvalitetsmedveten. Du har också förmågan att anpassa dig till ändrade förutsättningar och kan prioritera rätt under tidspress. Du kommer också att behöva din analytiska förmåga.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Anställningen är ett vikariat till och med 2026-08-31. Tillträde efter överenskommelse. Anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Du måste vara svensk medborgare, men får gärna ha utländsk bakgrund.
   

  

 Vi kommer att genomföra intervjuer löpande under rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?**
 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta enhetschef Louise Hallquisth 08-405 20 86 eller rekryteringsspecialist Hanady Hussein på 08-405 58 53. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Jan Wahlström för ST och Johan Strokirk för Saco som nås på 08-405 10 00. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg
 **senast den 18 mars!**
 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Förvaltningsavdelningen ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor som förändrings- och förnyelsearbete, ekonomi, arbetsgivarfrågor, kompetensförsörjning, kommunikation, säkerhet, it, bibliotek, arkiv och registratur samt för den gemensamma servicen i Regeringskansliet.

title: Director of Communications and Marketing
description:
**Doctors Without Borders/Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) Sweden is looking for Director of Communication and Marketing** 




  





  





 We are on a journey of transformation, merging our Communications & Advocacy and Marketing to become even stronger and more effective in our communications efforts. We are now looking for a Swedish speaking Director of Communication and Marketing to lead and develop the department, which consists of 25 employees, including unit managers for Campaign, Content, and Press & Advocacy. As the Director of Communication and Marketing, you will report to our General Director and be part of the MSF Sweden Management Team.
 



  





**The role** 




 The role has an overall responsibility for implementing the purpose of the department: To effectively communicate MSFs humanitarian efforts and values, raising awareness and engagement across Swedish society. Through innovative marketing strategies and strong messaging we aim to· Generate financial support for MSF’s humanitarian mission:
 



 · Raise awareness to inspire action and solidarity with people affected by humanitarian crisi
 



 · Position MSF as the leading international medical humanitarian organisation in Swede
 



 · Influence policy and practices that can improve the situation for our patients and for other
 



 · Support and strengthen MSF Sweden’s staff recruitment ambitions.
 



  





**Main responsibilities** 




 · Lead and empower teams, develop and implement overarching communication and marketing strategies that support MSF overall goals
 



 · Oversee and guide external communication efforts to ensure alignment with strategic objectiv
 



 · Collaborate with other functions to ensure that communication and marketing efforts are synchronized with MSF’s overall strategy
 



 · Create sustainable working climate by leading with values, supporting employee development and creating a culture of learning
 



 · Actively contribute as a member of MSF SE Management Team (MT) with shared accountability for the overall strategic direction, operational excellence, and organizational development of MSF Sweden.
 



  





**We are looking for you with** 




 · A strong commitment to MSF values and humanitarian principals
 



 · Academic degree in Marketing, Communications or a related field
 



 · Minimum of 8 years’ experience from a leadership role with staff responsibility within marketing and communications or a related field
 



 · Experience of working in the non-profit sector
 



 · A leadership that drives change, fostering engagement for innovation, and enhancing ways of working
 



 · Very good ability to develop and implement long-term strategies, good skills in project management and experience in developing, communicating and implementing strategic pl
 



 ans.· Fluency in spoken and written Swedish and English
 



  





**It’s valuable if you have** 




 · Experience in cross-functional collabora
 



 · Strong creative and analytical skills and experience in data driven communication
 



  





**Employment terms and condions** 




 itions· Type of contract: Permanent (6 months probation period)·
 



 Contract duration: Full-time position
 



 · Entry date: Preferably beginning of May 2025, can be discussed.
 



 · Goal oriented working time (37,5 hours/week is fulltime)
 



 · Salary: 64.612 SEK/month (if you have 8 years' experience as required). The salary is set according to the MSF Sweden Salary policy.
 



 · Benefits: Pension, health insurance, life insurance, travel insurance, insurance for work related injuries, wellness contribution (3000 SEK/year) and one wellness hour per week. Full compensation day 1-14 of sick leave· Vacation: 32 days/year + 3,5 extra vacation days for all employees (which varies from year to year)
 



 · Work Style: In-Person at the office in Liljeholmen, Stockholm.
 



 · As an employee with MSF Sweden, you are bound by the collective bargaining agreement for non-profit organisations between Fremia and Unionen & Akademikerförbunden.
 



  





**Apply no later than Marc** 
 h 17th with resume and answer the questions on motivation in our recruitment system. We only accept application through our recruitment system due to GDPR. MSF values diversity and is committed to create an inclusive working environment. We are an equal opportunity employer, who welcomes all qualified applications. We encourage you to apply without a photo in your CV and only focus on presenting achievements, skills, and experience relevant to the job.
 



  





**The social environment at MSF** 




 SwedenThe social environment at MSF Sweden As an employee at MSF Sweden you will be part of a movement providing people with medical aid and humanitarian care. We work in an international, informal and welcoming environment. All of us working for MSF Sweden have a strong engagement to our common goal, saving lives and alleviate suffering. We are a value-based organization which is strongly felt whether you work in a project, as a volunteer or employed in the office. We work in teams, which means we all must take responsibility, trust each other and work on giving and taking feedback. We are easy going and never hesitate when someone needs our help. We want you to feel respected, whoever you are. Working at MSF means you have the possibility to take initiative and, in that way, learn and grow, both on an individual and a team level. To be able to save lives and alleviate suffering, communication is essential, both internally between the office and projects, and externally from us to the world.
 



  





 Questions regarding the role? Please contact Kristofer Myrevik, Senior Partner, Brightness Executive Search. kristofer.myrevik@brigh
 



 tness.seLocal Union Representative (Unionen) is Mia Hejdenberg, mia.hejdenberg@stockholm
 



 .msf.orgWe are looking forward to reviewing your application!
 



  





  





 Doctors without Borders/Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) is an international medical humanitarian organization determined to bring quality medical care to people in crises around the world, when and where they need regardless of religion, ethnical background or political view. Our fundamental principles are neutrality, impartiality, independence and medical ethics. In Sweden we raise funds, recruit field workers, communicate, advocate for change and provide operational services to contribute to saving lives and alleviating suffering in the world. We are around a hundred people working for MSF Sweden at our office at Liljeholmen, Stockholm.

title: Subject Matter Expert Energy & Utilities
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 CGI, a global leader in IT and business consulting, is seeking a dynamic Subject Matter Expert (SME) Energy & Uitilities t to join our team in Stockholm.
