title: Summer Worker at Traction Control
description:
Req ID: 480529

  


At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, more than 80 000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

  


**Could you be our future summer worker in Traction Control team, based in Västerås?**  

  

**Your future role:**  

The role is open for 8 weeks of summer work in the Traction Control department. The work will typically involve:


* Identifiy gaps in the avialable documentation together with the Software Lead,
* Update our Model-based Design Guideline to refelct recent updates in the process and tools,
* Create additional documents for in-house deleveloped tools.


  

**All about you**
* MATLAB and Simulink experince,


* Model-based desing or model-based software engineer knowledge,


* English writing and speaking.


  

**You have also:**  

* Curiosity and autonomy,


* Attention to details,
* High level of adaptability,
* Very good communication skills.

  


**Things you’ll enjoy**


Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:


* Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
* Contribute to innovative projects
* Benefit from our investment in your development

  




You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

  


**Important to note**


As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.
company_description: Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation.

title: Automation Engineer
description:
### **Join Us in Transforming the Future of Finance with Automation**



At Ikano Bank, our mission is to create possibilities for a better living, making financial services accessible and simple for consumers and businesses alike. As part of the Automation Office, you will play a crucial role in driving operational efficiency, leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Digital Process Automation (DPA), low-code platforms, and AI.



We are seeking a passionate and innovative **Automation Engineer** to join our team and support our vision of continuous improvement and excellence in business processes.


### **Your Impact**



As an Automation Engineer in the Automation Office, you will work with stakeholders across Ikano Bank to develop, test, and implement automation solutions that streamline business processes and boost efficiency. You’ll design and deploy automation workflows using RPA, DPA, low-code platforms, and AI technologies. Your collaboration with IT, other departments, and external partners will ensure that the automation initiatives meet business requirements and deliver high-quality results.



In this role, you will be the technical contributor, driving innovation in automation, while ensuring the smooth operation of deployed solutions.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Design, configure, test, and deploy automation solutions using RPA, DPA, and AI technologies.
* Monitor and maintain automated workflows, troubleshooting and optimizing processes to ensure smooth operations.
* Develop detailed process documentation and work closely with the scrum team to ensure quality automation solutions.
* Conduct code reviews and ensure the quality, performance, and security of automated solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business users, developers, business analysts, and project managers and translate them into technical solutions.
* Stay ahead of the latest trends in automation technologies to continually improve solutions and enhance business efficiency.

### **Are You the One for Ikano?**



We are looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and is passionate about using technology to transform business processes. You have strong technical expertise in automation and are eager to develop innovative solutions that deliver real value to the business.


**Experience & Skills:**


* Proven experience as an Automation Engineer or RPA Developer, with tools like UiPath or similar (3+ years).
* Experience working in Agile or Scrum teams and delivering automation projects on time is a must.
* Proven experience on the Microsoft Power Platform stack is an advantage.
* Experience with programming/software development such as REST, SQL, Python, Java, Javascript, VBA and/or .Net will be considered as an advantage.
* Familiarity with AI and Machine Learning technologies as applied to process automation is an advantage.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot and optimize automation workflows.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to engage and collaborate with stakeholders across the organization.

### **We Offer You**



Join a team at the center of business transformation at Ikano Bank. As part of the Automation Office, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects that shape the future of our processes. You’ll be part of a collaborative, innovative environment where your expertise will make a tangible impact on our success. You will work with friendly colleagues that support each other. Ikano Bank offers flexibility in terms of working from home, but you will be expected to work from the office a number of days each week.



Let’s work together to simplify finance for the many people.


### **Join us now – together we will find a better way**



We look forward to receiving your application with a CV and cover letter no later than the 31th of March. Please note that we are unable to accept any applications via email. Lastly, for the candidates remaining towards the end of this recruitment process there might be a request to work on a small showcase project. Detailed instructions for this will be communicated to the concerned persons.



In this recruitment there is no relocation support provided by Ikano Bank, hence we are looking for people already living in or within commuting distance of the mentioned location and having the relevant work permits.


### **About Ikano Bank AB (publ)**



Ikano Bank creates possibilities for better living by offering simple, fair, and affordable services, enabling a healthy economy for the many people and businesses. Its offer includes savings and loan products for consumers, sales support services for retailers, and leasing and factoring solutions for businesses. Ikano Bank operates in Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, the UK, Poland, Germany and Austria, and is a part of Ingka Group. Ikano Bank’s head office is located

title: R&D Summer job - Xylem
description:
Join Xylem in the global mission to #LetsSolveWater! As a leading water technology company with 23,000 employees operating in over 150 countries, Xylem is at the forefront of addressing the world's most critical water challenges. We invite passionate individuals to join our team, dedicated to exceeding customer expectations through innovative and sustainable solutions.
Would you like to be the one to join us at Xylem this summer!
We are looking for you who are studying at high school or university and looking for a company where you can start building your career alongside your studies.
We offer you an opportunity to gain hands-on experience of working at a global company with operations in over 150 countries. It is also an opportunity for you to explore your skills across your desired profession and aspire a career with high ambitions.
Xylem is a leading global water technology company dedicated to solving the world’s most challenging water challenges. At our headquarter in Sundbyberg we have a large R&D department with our own lab. This is just one of many areas where you will have the chance to learn from our innovative and professional colleagues.
Please visit Om oss – Xylem Inc. | Xylem Sverige to learn more about us.
Responsibilities
Our summer jobs are available throughout our business. Our need for summer workers varies and there are opportunities within below business areas:* Research and Development
* Product development
* Mechanical engineering
* Design
* Software/Hardware Engineering
* Test engineering
* Application engineering


Personal characteristics
We believe you have an interest in technology. You are a service-minded and curious team player who loves to collaborate with others. You are energetic, likes the idea of innovation and believe that success is made from teamwork and partnership.
You must be at least 18 years old and should be able to work for a period of at least 4-8 weeks during the summer months of June-August
We offer you an exciting career in an international environment, with a global network.  

We will focus on your personal development and help you realize your ambitions and potential for your future career path.
Apply for this position through Careers. If you are interested in this position and would like to know more, please contact Leila Sayyad, HR, leila.sayyad@xylem.com.*Welcome with your application!**The representative* *for Unionen is* *Mikael Lövås and the representative for the Swedish Association of Graduate Engineers* *“Sveriges Ingenjörer”* *is Lukas Limrell, tel: +46 8 475 60 00.*
Join the global Xylem team to be a part of innovative technology solutions transforming water usage, conservation, and re-use. Our products impact public utilities, industrial sectors, residential areas, and commercial buildings, with a commitment to providing smart metering, network technologies, and advanced analytics for water, electric, and gas utilities. Partner with us in creating a world where water challenges are met with ingenuity and dedication; where we recognize the power of diversity, equity and inclusion in driving innovation and allowing us to compete more effectively around the world.
company_description: Let's Solve Water!

title: Release Test Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**

  


Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.


* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than **400 million** active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv **with high ambitions**.


We, the **Release team**, manage app releases across platforms. We coordinate with external and internal stakeholders to ensure seamless releases are delivered every week. We also monitor the quality of these releases, report and escalate blockers. As part of the team, you will help implement and improve Release processes for planning, operations, and continuous improvements . You will be expected to coach, guide and onboard people when it comes to release practices.



As a Release Test Engineer, you will make sure that every step of the app release process is executed and that the results satisfy our release criteria. The steps include regression testing, risk analysis, coordination with Business units, cherry-picking of critical bugs as well as control and communication of features released. It also includes building new tools and enabling technologies to improve the Release process and enable other teams to deliver updates faster and more efficiently. You will be part of the Release team working and maintaining core processes at Truecaller.


**The impact you will create:**


* Releasing the app across various platforms.
* Communicate and coordinate with Product and Engineering teams regarding releases every week.
* Drive cross-BU initiatives to enable or improve the Release Delivery process.
* Evaluate new modern tools and technologies to be integrated into the process.
* Maintain and improve CI pipelines.
* Onboarding of engineers to the release process.
* Develop and handle strategies for app releases.
* Create and document app release strategies and flows.
* Identify test activities and test dependencies that span across the backend and frontend domain to ensure the end to end quality.
* Coordinate/coach the developer’s participation in the team's test activities.
* Monitor app vitals and issue escalations raised internally and externally.
* Automate test cases to ensure faster and reliable regression coverage.
* Automate Release workflows.
* Be a gatekeeper for all team deliverables agreed quality levels to ensure that acceptance criteria and definition of done are met before a task is closed


**What you bring in:**


* 3 to 7 years of relevant experience in Mobile app testing.
* Have a genuine passion for software quality and testing.
* Experience of testing in a medium or large-scale agile software development environment.
* Strong technical and troubleshooting skills.
* Familiarity with Data analysis, basic understanding of SQL, and handling data dashboards.
* Understanding and hands-on experience in UI test automation on mobile platforms, Android, iOS and Web automation.
* Experience with Android testing frameworks such as Espresso or Appium.
* Experience with Backend testing.
* Programming experience to be able to identify causes of problems in the code base and communicate efficiently with developers.
* Excellent manual testing skills.
* Experience with Issue & Project Tracking Software - JIRA.
* Experience with Android Studio and Xcode(optional).
* Experience in tools like Postman, Charles Proxy or similar.
* Experience with Firebase Crashlytics.
* Experience with version controlling tools like Github etc and CI/CD tools like Github actions etc.
  


**It would be great if you also have:**


* Experience working in a Startup.
* Programming experience to be able to identify the causes of problems in the code base and communicate efficiently with developers.
* Building and maintaining automation frameworks from scratch.
* Experience in efficient communication with various stakeholders like POs, PMs, QAs etc
* Experience with working in multi-cultural and distributed environments.
* Experience with handling customer support issues.
* Experience in web platforms testing is good to have.

  



Sounds like your dream job?



We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.



 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.



We only accept applications in English.


**What we offer:**


* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!


**Come as you are:**  

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Senior OBD Calibration Engineer
description:
Telescope Services har som konsultbolag sedan början av 2000-talet anställt och flyttat ingenjörer och specialister från hela världen till Sverige. Idag har vi circa 150 stycken utländska ingenjörer på konsultuppdrag hos flertalet av våra olika klienter. Vårt huvudkontor är placerat i Lund, men vi har rekryteringskontor i över 10 olika länder.
  
  

**Job Description:**  

Coming emission legislation requires development of advanced control strategies together with an optimized hardware. You will be an important contributor in this development. We work in agile teams with good collaboration with our colleagues in software development and design teams. Our daily work is an exciting mix of time spent in engine laboratory, virtual testing, simulation, data analysis, creative meetings and vehicle testing. You get the opportunity to follow your calibration from draft to test cell to verification in a truck. Expeditions in warm and cold climate are also included. Leading the team in certification activities and supporting the team in securing the documentations for specific emission markets.
  
We plan our work according to agile principles, where each team plan their activities in sprints and deliver solutions together as a team. You are encouraged to take on tasks of your own as soon as possible, with support from experienced colleagues. We strive to have an open and honest environment within the teams, where it is easy to ask each other for support when needed. The tasks can be either part of a larger long-term project or short tasks to improve products currently in production.
  
Qualifications
  
* MSc Engineering or similar qualification
* Fluent in English, written and spoken
* We see that you have at least three years of experience in Powertrain Onboard Diagnostics calibration. You have experience in combustion diagnostics modeling and optimization and from testing in engine test cell. You are well familiar with OBD and Emission legal requirements and have proven leadership experience.
* Experience in securing technical documentation and certification documentations for different emission legislations.
* Experience in working with simulation using Matlab and Simulink
* We see that you have experience in coordinating and leading cross functional teams in complex projects
* Experience in calibration tools like Vision, Creta etc.
* Experience in working in agile teams

title: Mechatronics Engineer
description:
**Work Description and Responsibilities:**  

We are looking for a consultant to work on our client site with autonomy in the defined area of technical expertise, with high technical complexity. Contribute to the development from research/early phases of development to product maintenance. Ensure the design fulfills the technical targets/requirements. Develop and share acquired competence and provide technical advice. Contribute to networking across the organization and sites. Network and build relationship with universities, external institutes and partners for own technical area.
  
  

**Experience and Skills Required:**  

A Master or Bachelor degree in Engineering (preferably Electrical Engineering, Physics Engineering or Mechatronics/Automation Engineering or Computer Science) or equivalent professional experience
  
Understand business needs and translate into software/hardware requirements for the vehicle communication interface
  
Design, develop, and maintain the test framework for vehicle communication hardware and software components
  
Design, develop and maintain software tools for data analysis and problem solving
  
Provide support to end users on vehicle communication issues analyzing logged data and performing root cause analysis
  
Be a real team player collaborating across different agile teams and also to external system and application teams
  
Proficient in communication in English, both verbally and in writing
  
  

**Additional skills/good to have (one or several):**  

Good knowledge about electronics / embedded SW development
  
Good knowledge in programming (Python, Javascript/Typescript)
  
Good knowledge in agile SW development way of working including continuous integration / continuous delivery / continuous deployment
  
Basic knowledge of vehicle communication protocols.
  
Basic knowledge of the equipment for electronics System testing (CANoe, CANalyzer, etc.)
  
SAFe and ISTQB certificates are merits
  
Knowledge about programming languages GoLang, C#, .NET is a merit
  
Knowledge about automotive diagnostics software and tools are considered to be a merit.
  
  

**Additional info:**  

We schedule interviews on a rolling basis so do not wait until end date.

title: Diagnostic Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Diagnostic Engineer for our client within the automotive industry. You will be working on the client's site in agile teams.
  
  

**Job Description:**  

* Develop diagnostic method information for aftermarket
* Create and maintain diagnostic specifications.
* Develop test and calibration operations on vehicle and component level.
* Support the development of new or changed functionality in various diagnostic tools
* Be a part of developing new data structure for future diagnostics content information.
* Implement test and calibration operations based on specifications.
* Analyze test result and manage corrections of issues.
* Review and approve all new and modified specifications.
* Perform unit test of the implemented method/operation and bugs
* Secure verification of the implemented method/operation.
* Ensure that the methods/operations fulfil good design practice


**Experience Required:**  

* Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Mechatronics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or similar
* Preferably 3 years of work experience within diagnostics
* Experience from the automotive industry plus if you have worked in Aftermarket
* Experience of Agile way of working-SAFe
* Used to working in an international environment
* A plus if you have experience in machine learning


**Skills Required:**  

* Good to have a software developer/Testing background
* Know CANoe/CANalyzer, and Python
* Driven, helpful and have a “can-dilled o attitude”
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Fluent in English both spoken and written
* Good at relationship building/networking
* A team player
* A plus if you have practical workshop /mechanic skills

title: System Design Engineer ESS
description:
Are you passionate about Elctromobility and want to work for environmentally friendly transport solutions. You will work in a cross-functional team responsible for developing complete Energy Storage Systems realized by hardware and software solutions.
  
  

**Job description:**  

* Working with concept design, from early phases and throughout product development including maintenance.
* Requirement specifications, collecting and breakdown of requirements.
* Working together with technology teams and system teams to define the system design to meet the requirements.
* Balancing of the technical solution and support for verification.
* Involving in the technical decisions towards projects and suppliers and making sure that we continuously improve quality.


**Experience Required:**  

* 5 years of experience from System design/architecture within automotive systems.
* Experience from development within Electrical Propulsion System.
* Experience of battery technologies/systems within the application of electric vehicles.
* Min. 3 years of experience from design within Energy Storage Systems.
* Good understanding of how Battery Packs building blocks and system attributes influence battery & vehicle system.
* Experience in defining requirement and balancing requirement between stakeholders and technical solution.
* Master degree in Mechatronics, Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or similar.
* Master of Science in control systems, mechatronics, electrical engineering, signal processing, or engineering physics.
* Strong aptitude in abstract thinking, rigorous mathematical modeling, system theoretic analysis, and model-based control design.
* High proficiency in MATLAB and Simulink based modelling/analysis.
* Some experience with embedded software development for control applications.
* Fluent in both written and spoken English.
* 5+ years of experience from Embedded software development design & development
* Knowledge of TargetLink, C/C++, Embedded SW/HW, Control Theory, HIL, driver license C/D, CAN, LIN, ISO 26262, J1939, AUTOSAR, Systems Engineering.


Any experience with electro-thermal and ageing dynamics of Lithium-ion batteries along with battery state estimation and control algorithms will be meritorious.
  
  

**Personal Skills:**  

We believe you are a driven team player that loves to develop system designs with the customer in focus. Since the area is in an early phase, it is important that you are flexible and enjoy working in a changing environment. You have a broad knowledge and experience of both Electrical and Mechanical development. Confident in leading system solution towards suppliers and product teams. We also believe that you feel comfortable of owning and taking responsibility of your system. Fluent in English both spoken and written. You have excellent communicational skills and enjoy collaboration and knowledge sharing. You are self-motivated, curious and passionate about innovation.

title: Senior Hardware & Systems Architect
description:
We are seeking a Senior Hardware & Systems Engineer to lead the design and development of power and hardware system architecture for an advanced industrial product. In this high-impact role, you will be responsible for ensuring that every component and system is selected and integrated for maximum scalability and efficiency. This greenfield project requires a high degree of autonomy, deep technical expertise, and strong decision-making skills.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
  

**– Comprehensive System Architecture:**  

Define and validate the complete power and hardware system, ensuring seamless integration of power electronics, embedded controllers, and peripheral devices.
  
  

**– Component Selection & Evaluation:**  

Identify, assess, and integrate off-the-shelf components—such as power electronics, MCUs, sensors, and other essential parts—optimizing for performance, cost, and reliability.
  
  

**– Collaboration with Electrical Engineering:**  

Work closely with electrical design engineers to develop safe and efficient power distribution solutions that incorporate embedded control systems.
  
  

**– Load Management & Safety Compliance:**  

Ensure the system operates safely and efficiently by strictly adhering to electrical safety standards such as IEC, ISO, UL, and CE.
  
  

**– Technical Leadership:**  

Provide expert guidance on key system decisions, including power conversion, energy distribution, and thermal management strategies.
  
  

**– Manufacturability & Scalability:**  

Make sure that the hardware design supports scalable production and assembly processes, aligning with long-term manufacturing goals.
  
Key Qualifications & Experience
  
  

**– Extensive Industry Experience:**  

Over 10 years in hardware and systems engineering, ideally with a background in power electronics, industrial automation, or embedded systems.
  
  

**– Deep Technical Expertise:**  

Proven in-depth knowledge of power electronics including AC/DC conversion, energy storage, and load balancing, alongside experience with off-the-shelf component sourcing and integration (e.g., inverters, contactors, power modules, industrial-grade sensors).
  
  

**– Systems Engineering Proficiency:**  

Strong ability to conceptualize the full system—from high-level architecture to detailed hardware implementation—with a proven track record in electrical design and safety standards (IEC, ISO, UL).
  
  

**– Embedded Hardware Know-How:**  

Familiarity with MCU/SoC selection, various I/O interfaces, and communication protocols such as CAN, Modbus, and RS485, as well as experience with RTOS environments.
  
  

**– Practical Skills:**  

Hands-on experience with prototyping and laboratory testing of power systems, complemented by a history of effective cross-functional collaboration with electrical, mechanical, and software teams.
  
  

**Required Skills:**  

– Automotive
  
– Electrical Hardware
  
– Electromechanical Systems
  
– Embedded Systems
  
– System Integration
  
– Electrical Safety
  
  

**Desirable Skills:**  

– IEC
  
– ISO
  
– CE
  
– MCU
  
– UL
  
  

**Languages:**  

– English (Expert)
  
– Swedish (Expert)
  
If you have a passion for innovation and a proven ability to lead complex system design projects, we invite you to apply and help shape the future of advanced industrial solutions.
  
About Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Join Our Team as a Process, Methods & Tools Engineer in Landskrona!
description:
At BorgWarner, we design and manufacture the systems that define the way the world moves forward. With the world’s foremost technologists, engineers and OEMs, we’re accelerating the world’s transformation to eMobility.
As a global product leader for over 130 years, we supply original equipment to nearly every major automotive OEM in the world. We continue to advance our emissions-reducing and fuel-efficient combustion technology while bringing successful electric innovations to market, empowering everyone to drive sustainably.
Guided by our commitment to inclusion, integrity, excellence, responsibility and collaboration—and our pledge to reach carbon neutrality by 2035—we’re leading the automotive industry to a future that is cleaner, healthier and safer for all. A future where driving well means living well.
About the Role:
As a Process, Methods & Tools Engineer, you'll develop and deploy engineering processes and methods, ensuring continuous improvement. You'll use your experience to align our processes with global standards like ASPICE, IATF 16949, and ISO 26262. Plus, you'll coach our project teams and take the role as Development Process Engineer in our projects.
What You'll Do:* Drive global ASPICE-compliant product development using our Engineering Development Framework (EDF) and tools.
* Develop engineering processes that comply with industry standards.
* Collaborate with global engineering teams to share best practices.
* Analyze process deployments, identify improvement opportunities, and develop solutions to meet quality goals.
* Create metrics to monitor process and tool effectiveness and drive continuous improvement.
* Develop training materials and share knowledge about our processes, roles, and responsibilities.
* Work with other functions to align EDF process interfaces with non-engineering systems.
* Partner with the Quality organization to address compliance issues and implement solutions.


What We're Looking For:
We are seeking a candidate with a bachelor’s degree in engineering, though a Master's degree is preferred. You should have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in Software- or Systems Engineering, preferably within the automotive industry, and extensive experience in process development, deployment, and team coaching. Demonstrated competency in Software Engineering, Systems Engineering and Software Quality Assurance is essential. Preferably you have good understanding of ASPICE-based systems development methodology and knowledge of software development processes. The ability to work effectively across functional and geographic boundaries is crucial since you will work with teams from all over the world. Preferred qualifications include knowledge in requirements definition, change management, problem resolution, and verification techniques. Strong oral and written communication skills in both English and Swedish are necessary.
One of the key elements of this role will be the ability to observe and gather information to create a cohesive strategy, implement processes effectively and to support teams to ensure that all processes are implemented and followed. As such we feel that the right candidate will demonstrate proven leadership, coaching, and team-building abilities. Familiarity with tools like JIRA, Polarion, SharePoint, PowerBI, and a background in 6 Sigma is a plus.
The role is a hybrid role with the ability to work from home two days a week with three days a week in the office.
We would like to receive your application as soon as possible, but no later than March 31st. We are working with ongoing selection and meet applicants continuously, which means that the position may be filled before this date.
If you have any questions about the role please contact Thobias Wååg, hiring manager at +46 (0)418-476 682.
Internal Use Only: Salary

Carefully read the BorgWarner Privacy Policy before using this website. Your ability to access and use this website and apply for a job at BorgWarner are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.
Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the geographical area where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.*Career Scam Disclaimer:* *BorgWarner makes no representations or guarantees regarding employment opportunities listed on any third-party website. To protect against career scams, job applicants should take the necessary precautions when interviewing for and accepting employment positions allegedly offered by BorgWarner. Applicants should never provide their national ID numbers, birth dates, credit card numbers, bank account information or other private information when communicating with prospective employers or responding to employment opportunities online. Job applicants are invited to contact BorgWarner through BorgWarner’s website to verify the authenticity of any employment opportunities.*

title: Engineer
description:
**Summer Internship 2025 at ASSA ABLOY Opening Solutions, Stockholm**  

Are you studying within tech or engineering and looking for a Summer Internship?
Are you interested in working in an international, dynamic and ambitious company where you can make a difference?  

  

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we at ASSA ABLOY open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.  

  

**Challenges and problem solving**
Our employees encounter new, exciting challenges within product development every day. These challenges often vary in field of work and complexity. Solving these means that we can take yet another step towards becoming even better than we are today.
The road to problem-solving is not always straight forward, and sometimes, requires an outside perspective from fresh and eager minds who loves a challenge. We invite you to take these challenges on as our Summer Intern.
We’re searching for; Engineers working with Embedded Development, Mechanics, Electronics, Software or Testing.
At our site in Liljeholmskajen, we focus on developing Electronic Access Control (EAC) systems, with ARX as our primary product. Our team of engineers works across various disciplines to design and refine cutting-edge security solutions.
Our products include:
* Door Controllers
* Readers (RFID, NFC, BLE)
* Electrical Locks

Our development expertise covers:
* C Programming
* Python Programming
* Electrical Design

With a strong focus on security, reliability, and innovation, we ensure our solutions meet the highest quality and safety standards. Our modern test environment allows us to rigorously verify every component, from hardware to embedded software, ensuring seamless integration in access control systems.  


**Make a difference!**
You will work closely with the responsible engineers and fellow interns. Last, but not least, these challenges are real-world problems that not only will make a huge difference for us but could also represent the starting point of your own journey with ASSA ABLOY!
These Summer Internships are based in Liljeholmskajan, Sweden, in our offices at a 5-10 minutes’ walk from the train station. Ideally, we are looking for candidates who are available June 1, 2025 – August 31, 2025.
 Application and contact
We review applications on an ongoing basis. You are welcome to apply, no later than March 16, 2025.
In your application, we invite you to specify which area/-s of competence you are interested in: Embedded Development, Mechanics, Electronics, Software, or Testing.
Kindly note that the projects are suitable for students who are currently studying within relevant areas.
If you have any questions or require more information, please contact HR Adviser, Tara Matsson tara.matsson@assaabloy.com  


**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**  

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
company_description: Let’s create a safer and more open world – together!

title: customer support agent
description:
teenage engineering develops highly acclaimed products for people who love sound, music and design. we are looking for a customer support agent to join our team.

  

general


as a customer support agent at teenage engineering, you will be the first point of contact for customers, handling inquiries, troubleshooting basic technical issues, and providing product support. your primary goal is to ensure customer satisfaction by delivering timely, helpful, and professional support. you will handle support requests both from our direct consumers and our partners (distributors and resellers). you will be working closely with two colleagues in the support team.

  

key responsibilities:

* respond promptly and professionally to customer inquiries
* provide accurate information regarding products, orders, and company policies
* process returns, exchanges, and warranty claims in accordance with company policies
* assist customers with basic troubleshooting and triaging customer issues
* escalate complex issues to tech support or relevant departments when necessary
* identify and report recurring customer issues, and support in proactively addressing them
* stay up to date with product features, company policies, and industry trends

  

skills & qualifications:

* previous experience in first-line customer support, preferably in a small-to-mid-sized company operating both an e-commerce and wholesale business
* proficiency in using customer support software (experience with zendesk is a plus)
* basic understanding of teenage engineering’s products and customers
* strong communication skills, both written and verbal
* ability to remain calm and professional in high-pressure situations.
* strong attention to detail and ability to multitask effectively
* fluent in spoken and written english

  

form of employment  

full time


location  

the position located at our hq in stockholm and will report to the commercial project lead. as this position is located in stockholm, a swedish work permit is required to apply. applicants not located in stockholm will not be considered.  

  

about the company  

teenage engineering is developing the alternative future of consumer electronics—each invention driven by need and made to last. since 2005, teenage engineering has dispatched a series of products that earned their spot as studio essentials for the acclaimed artists, producers, and instrumentalists we all know and admire. from OP–1 field to pocket operators, OP–XY to OD–11, they have applied their signature mindset to building a new legacy of technology that continues to shape the industry as we know it. their hq is located in stockholm, sweden, where a multidisciplinary team of software, electrical, and mechanical engineers and industrial designers are developing their products from start to finish. the studio is a fully equipped workshop with state-of-the-art rapid prototyping machines.


we believe in culture / people / technology / discipline / curiosity / humor. we have a collective agreement “tekniktjänsteavtalet unionen/sveriges ingenjörer”.


teenage engineering is an equal-opportunity employer. we do not discriminate on the basis of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age or disability status.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Java)
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***
**Who We Are…**
 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
   

  

 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
   

  

 Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.
   

  

**Your New Role...**
 The Commerce group is part of the Core & Data organisation within WBD’s Global Tech division. Our services handle all aspects of monetizing our streaming services. This includes everything from managing products, pricing, and promotions; selling subscriptions and pay-per-view events; integration with 3rd party providers for global and local payment methods; handling taxes, fraud, financial reporting, and much, much more. We provide the backend APIs that power all our clients, and our teams own design, build, maintain, and are responsible to both deploy and operate our services. The group is currently based in the US, Sweden, Poland and India. Come join our talented team of experienced Engineers, working together on solving the most rewarding challenges in an autonomous and friendly work environment!
   

  

**Your Role Accountabilities...**
* You are able to work autonomously to design and develop functional changes to existing software systems. You require little or no guidance from team members. You still actively seek input where appropriate and engage your team to inform and share what you are doing.
* You can collaborate with other engineers assisting on features another engineer designed or taking the lead on feature design yourself. Your software contributions are demonstrated to work in production, and your team trusts your decisions, designs, and code.
* You are able to describe and defend your design and code decisions to other engineers, embrace constructive feedback, and adapt your approach to align with team and company standards and objectives.
* You consistently demonstrated good software ownership practices (e.g. code reviews, code comments, etc) in all of your contributions. Your code reviews are uneventful, you prepare documentation proactively, and you ensure proper monitoring for operational excellence in production.
* You offer enhancements to best practices, document, design, and architecture improvements, and as feedback through code reviews to other engineers without continuous prompting or recurring encouragement. Other engineers appreciate your feedback.
* You can troubleshoot a production issue by reviewing source code, logs, operational metrics, stack trace, etc to pinpoint a specific problem and then resolve it.


**Qualifications And Experience...**
* Proficient in Java or other JVM languages.
* Experience and deep understanding of Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS.
* Great understanding of distributed systems challenges, micro-service-based architectures, and asynchronized communication (e.g. using gRPC and Kafka).
* Ability to implement alerting, metrics, and logging using tools like Prometheus, CloudWatch, Kibana, PagerDuty.
* Practical knowledge of persistence and caching solutions such as PostgreSQL, Redis, ElasticSearch, Caffeine.
* Familiar with asynchronous, non-blocking, functional/reactive styles of programming. Hands-on experience with frameworks such as Spring WebFlux, Vert.x, Node.js.


**How We Get Things Done…**
 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
   

  

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**
 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
   

  

 If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

title: Mobile SDK Developer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our mobile client SDKs are key to how our customers integrate their products with our platform. We have clients ranging from small businesses to large enterprises, and their mobile apps are used by millions of people worldwide. By developing our voice and video SDKs together with the team, you will play a pivotal role in powering all those real-time conversations.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Mobile SDK Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing mobile SDKs while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop SDKs using WebRTC technology to optimize real-time communication features.
* Work with the team to align SDK APIs and features across multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, and Web/JavaScript.
* Develop cross-platform solutions using a C++ codebase shared between iOS and Android.
* Design APIs with simplicity in mind while maintaining modularity, extensibility, and API stability over time.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Professional expertise in modern C++, especially in mobile applications development.
* Professional experience developing for the iOS and/or Android platform.
* Experience with at least one of Kotlin or Objective-C/Swift.
* Experience working in Linux/macOS development environments and CI pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Experience with WebRTC protocols and NAT traversal, including ICE, STUN, and TURN, is a significant advantage.
* Experience developing software libraries and/or SDKs consumed by other developers.
* In-depth knowledge of network protocols such as IP, TCP, UDP, and DNS.
* Great debugging and troubleshooting skills.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with hybrid work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Growth Engineer - Analytics
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
We want a data-obsessed engineer to decode how our customers use Lovable and turn those insights into explosive growth. You'll create automated systems that predict user behavior, find magic moments, and tell us what to build next. Must combine serious coding skills with the ability to turn complex data into winning product bets (and help implement them).
   

  

 Why Lovable?
   

  

* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
* Work, learn, have fun: We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


 What we're looking for
   

  

* A builder who thinks in systems and code, not just SQL queries and dashboards
* Supernatural ability to spot patterns in messy data and turn them into actionable insights
* Obsession with understanding why users do what they do
* Strong opinions about what metrics actually matter
* Passion for using AI to automate analysis and surface insights


 Your responsibilities
   

  

* Own our north star metrics and make them go up and to the right
* Find "aha moments" that turn users into paying customers & shape our dev roadmap
* Build automated systems that tell us when something is wrong before our users do
* Own our dashboards and tools and use them to make all of us data-driven
* Build and run a killer A/B testing program for product & marketing initiatives
* This is an in-office role (5 days a week)


 Our tech stack
   

  

 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* And always exploring what's next


 How applying works
   

  

* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* We'll send you a quick take-home for (1) a written case study and (2) a loom video presentation
* If possible, join us for a week of (paid) trial work. We'll see you working in-person and you get to meet the team & explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you
